results.title: What am I bid for the tree?
results.creator_credit: Barrie Oldfield and Oldfield and Sons
results.brief_description: A satirical approach to the value of trees. Actor, James Bailey, by taking on various guises - teacher, philosopher, auctioneer, architect - tries to inform an uninterested audience of the many uses of the tree. Filmed at Wungong Brook, Western Australia - a film for Arbor Day. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: What's in a symbol?
results.creator_credit: Gyorgy Karpati and League of Red Cross Societies et al
results.brief_description: A documentary of the history and activities of the Red Cross from its foundation in 1859 to the present day. Emphasises its role in providing help and protection to citizens worldwide. Depicts delegates and volunteers at work in war zones, assisting refugees and prisoners, tracing families and working with the urban poor and drug addicts.

results.title: Wharfie
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd-Anderson and A Fitzroy Flix Film
results.brief_description: Impressionistic, non-narrated study of Melbourne Waterfront in which and old ex-wharfie returns to the wharves with his grandson to be confronted by vast technological changes. Still photographs and newspaper headlines refer back to more boisterous days when the wharves employed many more men.

results.title: Whales: Can they be saved?
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Post, Alan P. Sloan and Reid-Cowan Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of species within the two major branches of the whale family: the baleen and the toothed whales. Describes their characteristics and behaviour. Because modern whaling is so efficient many whales are in danger of extinction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth Post, Alan P. Sloan and Reid-Cowan Productions

results.title: Whales that wouldn't die
results.creator_credit: Frank Christopher, Susan K Pollock and KPBS (Television station : San Diego, Calif.)
results.brief_description: Studies the characteristics, population density and habitats of the Grey Whale. Discusses the history of whaling, its particular effect on the Grey Whale, and the animal’s future prospects for survival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Christopher, Susan K Pollock and KPBS (Television station : San Diego, Calif.)

results.title: 500 million years beneath the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Jacques Cousteau and his divers survey the 500 million years of life beneath the sea and explain how man’s exploitation of the natural resources of the coastal zones of the world are jeopardising this life.

results.title: Octopus octopus
results.creator_credit: Les Requins Associes and Metromedia Producers Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Narrated by Rod Serling. This cinematic companion to Cousteau’s book, “Octopus and Squid: The Soft Intelligence” seeks to dispel some long standing misapprehension’s about this gorgeous aquatic chameleon. Fantastic underwater cinematography attests to the octopus’ fluid grace and delicate sensuality. In the Mediterranean Sea, Captain Cousteau and his divers explore the underwater world of the octopus. He demonstrates that it is a small creature of great shyness. In a laboratory tank we see the courtship and breeding of a male and female, and the octopus embryos are followed through the remarkable process of birth. Cast includes Jacques Cousteau.

results.title: The Night of the squid
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Sea Arrow Squids gather in large masses during their annual mating frenzy. The males transfer packets of sperm from their bodies to that of the female by using a specially adapted tentacle. The female attaches the fertilised egg clusters to the sea bottom where they hatch in approximately 28 days. Commentary by Rod Serling.

results.title: Sunken treasure
results.creator_credit: Jacques Cousteau Productions and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Shows Jacques Cousteau and his crew exploring the site of a wreck believed to be the command ship of the 1641 New World Armada. Also shows the crew testing some new ideas about underwater archaeological salvaging techniques. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Coral jungle
results.creator_credit: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Jacques Cousteau Productions and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
The coral reef with its myriad of little homes, caves and crevices is an attractive centre for tropical marine life. A delicate balance is maintained by all its inhabitants, for life on the reef is a continuous struggle to survive. Jacques Cousteau and the crew of Calypso are shown examining the different varieties of plants and animals in the reefs. Commentator: Rod Serling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Jacques Cousteau Productions and Wolper Productions
